page.title: 03Richardson Dees Park
page.content: We attend Saint Columba's School.It is one of the newest schools in our area. Our new sports field has been laid out and seeded but we cannot use it yet. Instead our Games teacher takes us out to a place we call The Valley.It is a large stretch of open ground between two housing developments,just over the way from our school.It is separated from Richardson Dees Park by a secondary road,so it seems like a private place to play.There is a stream which runs through the centre into the pond in the park opposite.It has two little bridges and some stepping stones.We enjoy jumping over it, especially in winter,when it is frozen. We use the grass for our long distance and handicap races.In summer it is a lovely place to enjoy a picnic.
